intro: Pistorinia breviflora subsp. breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered pistorinia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. It is an erect perennial herb that grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and relatively understudied species.
